revised_title: The Impact of Nitrogen-Fixing Organisms and Nucleic Acid Derivatives on Plant Growth
tldr: This study investigates the effect of nitrogen-fixing organisms, specifically Azotobacter chroococcum, and nucleic acid derivatives on the growth of Lemna minor plants. The results show that the addition of Azotobacter chroococcum to the culture solution increases the rate of multiplication and size of the plants, while the control plants experience a decrease in weight. The study also suggests that nucleic acid derivatives from raw peat may play a role in the observed growth promotion.
